newsitem.title: THAILAND: Angry Sanyo workers set fire to offices in Thailand.
newsitem.headline: Angry Sanyo workers set fire to offices in Thailand.

text.p: About five hundred Thai employees ransacked and set fire to a warehouse and office complex of Sanyo Electric PLC on Tuesday to protest against reduced year-end bonuses, police said.

Police said the disgruntled workers, who torched the warehouse and a seven-storey office building, were angered by a decision of the Sanyo management to give them smaller annual bonuses than last year after three rounds of inconclusive negotiations since Monday.
Police could not immediately estimate damage caused by the fire which raged for several hours in a Bangkok eastern suburb.
Prime minister Chavalit Yongchaiyudh and Interior Minister Smoh Thienthong rushed to the Sanyo complex to supervise police fighting the fire.
